main event: An unknown object was detected by ground radar at Kirtland Air Force Base in New Mexico on 20th August 1952 at 0300.
interesting points: The object was detected by ground radar and traveled from east to west.
The report includes witness statements of a large, silvery, triangular-shaped object emitting solid lights and traveling at high speeds.
No photographs, CGI, or recordings were obtained of the object.
A witness initially thought the object was a meteor until it changed direction and speed, prompting the sighting to be reported as a UFO.
The sighting lasted for approximately three minutes.
sighted object: large, silvery, triangular-shaped object emitting solid lights
location: Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico
witnesses: LT Col Joseph William Jagmin, Capt James McDonald USAF, and ground radar operators
